answers.answer: Hello,Your symptoms are suggestive of various possibilities.These include anemia,hypothyroidism,diabetes and deficiency of vit B12.Take some iron supplements and multivitamins like vit B12 for some days and see if the symptoms persist.If yes,then pls get a thyroid profile and fasting blood glucose tests done.Also consult a physician.Hope it helps.Take care and pls do keep me posted on how you are doing.

thanks, i went into an urgent care on saturday and they said it probably was not diabetes because my blood glucose was normal.Other notes about me.-today i slept in for 14.5 hours (which i have never slept longer then 12 hours).-I tried to jog a little today and noticed i dont have near the stamina as the past two years, and noticed i started to feel dizzy and lightheaded after 5 minutes of a slow jog.-I was losing my concentration/focus throughout the day, and my forearms started to tingle for no apparent reason when i tried to stretch them out.-I do not drink, nor smoke, and generally eat healthier then most people.thanks

Hello,Tingling sensations are a common feature in diabetes, stroke, multiple sclerosis and underactive thyroid, Abnormal levels of calcium, potassium, or sodium in your body and a lack of vitamin B12  and some neurological illnesses.As I have asked you in earlier post,tiredness can be due to anemia(deficiency of iron or vit B 12).Pls take some iron supplements and vit B 12 supplements for some days and see if the symptoms improve.If they don’t then pls get your thyroid hormones levels evaluated.Hope it helps. Take care and pls do keep me posted on how you are doing if you have any additional queries.

ok thank you for your input. if anything this ordeal is more scary then what is accutally happening to me. Later today i get the blood work back and hopefully that will tell me what is wrong with me.Thank you for your input. Hopefully it is nothing to severe. I will let you know what doctors say.

updatewell my alt and ast levels came up high (in the 150's)im not really sure why, since that is due to number of factors. i do not drink or smoke.I read that it could be a virus but i do not feel any of the symptoms of a virus. Just tingly throughout the body and extreme dizzyness.Doctor got a Ct scan for the head and ultrascan on the liver.Im waiting for those tests to come back. any thoughts on what it possibly is?thanks

Hello,The normal ranges for AST and ALT are around 0 to 40 IU/L and 0 to 45 IU/L respectively.If your enzymes are in 150’s,so definitely they are a lot elevated.Elevated liver enzymes are found in hepatitis,fatty liver,alcoholic liver disease,obesity,diabetes(uncontrolled),infectious mononucleosis,autoimmune hepatitis,metabolic liver disease,gallstones,tumors of liver,pancreas and bile ducts and side effects of medicines like certain nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), cholesterol medications, antibiotics or anti-seizure medications.The approach of the doctors is right in getting an ultrasound liver and CT head so as to rule out the hepatic and neurological causes of raised liver enzymes and correlating the investigations with your symptoms of fatigue and dizziness.Confirmatory diagnosis can be made only after these investigations.Hope it helps .Take care and pls do keep us posted about the test reports and in case you have any additional queries.Kind regards.
well the ultrasound of the liver came back and nothing is abnormal in that. the rest still havent come back.what does the good ultrasound rule out?

question: i am a 18 year old male that is physically active. The past two weeks i have been experiencing rather worrysome symptoms. This has happend to me four times the past two weeks. During minimal sports activity i feel a rush of dizzyness, lightheaded, fainting, numbness in toes, confusion, really really sore legs-almost like dead weight, and pain in stomach,irritibility, more thirsty. While this happend to me i took a break for 10 minutes and found that gatorade made me close to 100% better.so i thought my symptoms might have to do with pre-diabetes? but when i took my blood glucose chart it wasnt out of the ordinary.Note: When my symptoms occur it isnt because im not used to pushing my body. infact i generally excersize close to 10 times harder and longer. it also isnt nerves because i have been put into this situation for the past four years and never had a problem.My grandpa has diabetes but thats it for family members. My mom and her sisters have hypothroidism but i heard it is rare for men to develop it. Any thoughts and thanks in advance
title: weird feelings occur during day
